definition: to slide/to coast/to glide/(of an aircraft) to taxi

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: I let the plane down gently, pulled off the runway, and taxied back to parking.
sentences.chinese: 我稳稳地降落了飞机，驶离跑道，滑行回了停机场。
他们穿四轮旱冰鞋在街上滑行。

sentences.english: The skaters glided gracefully over the ice.
sentences.chinese: 溜冰者们在冰面上优美地滑行。

sentences.english: High-speed thrills are one of the chief attractions of skiing on grass.
sentences.chinese: 享受高速滑行的快感，是滑草主要的乐趣之一。

sentences.english: The engine shut off, and we coasted to a stop.
sentences.chinese: 引擎熄火了，我们滑行了一段后停了下来。

sentences.english: Some people think that coasting is less fuel-efficient because it takes up fuel to start up the engine.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为滑行并不怎么省油，因为启动引擎耗油。

sentences.english: At very beginning, i slided down smoothly.
An airplane taxiing down the runway.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着喷射机沿跑道滑行。

sentences.english: The whole world was full of things rolling, slithering and falling.
sentences.chinese: 整个世界充满了转动，滑行和跌落。

sentences.english: The old EW taxiway has been partially removed.
sentences.chinese: 旧的电子战滑行道已被部分删除。

sentences.english: One was stroking, and the other was gliding.
sentences.chinese: 他们一个在划水，另一个在滑行。

sentences.english: A jet plane lands and taxis onto a remote airstrip.
sentences.chinese: 一架喷气式飞机滑行并降落在一个偏僻的飞机跑道上。

sentences.english: The plane taxied along the runway.
This all-natural, organic glide-coat is designed to make swallowing your vitamins effortless.
sentences.chinese: 这种全天然，有机滑行外套是为了使吞咽维他命轻松。

sentences.english: Seakeeping capability of conventional planing hull is poor.
sentences.chinese: 常规滑行艇的耐波性能很差。

sentences.english: Push to the side, and glide…… Knees together when you recover, and try to pull your foot in.
sentences.chinese: 侧蹬，然后滑行，收腿时膝盖要碰上，脚尽量往里收。

definition: to turn/to go around a corner
to catapult/to launch/to eject (from a plane)/to shoot
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
to rise/to ascend/to climb (airplane etc)/to go up (sales figures etc)/to gain promotion
